name: Condition
title: Google
Monitoring
V3
AlertPolicy
Condition
description: A condition is a true/false test that determines when an alerting policy should open an incident. If a condition evaluates to true, it signifies that something is wrong.

returns.description:
Required if the condition exists. The unique resource name for this condition. Its syntax is:

projects/[PROJECT_ID]/alertPolicies/[POLICY_ID]/conditions/[CONDITION_ID]

+[CONDITION_ID]+ is assigned by Stackdriver Monitoring when the condition is created as part of a new or updated alerting policy.

When calling the Google::Monitoring::V3::AlertPolicyService::CreateAlertPolicy method, do not include the +name+ field in the conditions of the requested alerting policy. Stackdriver Monitoring creates the condition identifiers and includes them in the new policy.

When calling the Google::Monitoring::V3::AlertPolicyService::UpdateAlertPolicy method to update a policy, including a condition +name+ causes the existing condition to be updated. Conditions without names are added to the updated policy. Existing conditions are deleted if they are not updated.

Best practice is to preserve +[CONDITION_ID]+ if you make only small changes, such as those to condition thresholds, durations, or trigger values. Otherwise, treat the change as a new condition and let the existing condition be deleted.
